isis.stitle: Procedural Guideline - ENGINE FRONT COVER - BOTH SECTIONS (I-6E), REPLACE

wtsproc.wtsdescrip: ENGINE FRONT COVER - BOTH SECTIONS (I-6E), REPLACE
wtsproc.config: Vehicle is equipped with air conditioning and air brakes.

step1.para: Chock wheels.
Disconnect battery.
Remove front bumper.
Raise vehicle and support vehicle with wood blocks under front tires.
Remove hood assembly (2 people).
Evacuate A/C system (if applicable).
Remove charge air pipes.
Drain cooling system.
Remove power steering reservoir from radiator frame. Lay aside and secure.
Remove all coolant hoses necessary to remove radiator assembly.
Disconnect A/C lines at A/C dryer and A/C compressor (if applicable).
Remove upper and side radiator assembly support struts.
Remove fan/clutch assembly. Use proper tools.
Install lifting device to radiator assembly. Remove lower radiator bolt. Remove radiator assembly as one unit.
Remove all drive belts.
Remove fan drive belt tensioner.
Remove fan drive pulley and fan drive housing.
Remove crankshaft damper. Use puller.
Remove oil pump assembly, include crankshaft drift key.
Remove water pump pulley and pump.
Remove camshaft position sensor.
Remove coolant filter for access.
Disconnect alternator wiring. Remove alternator mount bracket with alternator attached.
Drain engine oil. Remove oil pan.
Remove oil pick up tube.
Loosen bolts retaining air compressor rear support bracket.
Remove bolts retaining air compressor to front cover.
Remove bolts retaining front engine mount to crossmember. Use bottle jack, raise/lower engine and remove front engine mount bracket.
Remove bolts retaining front cover. Remove front cover front section.

note.para: Stop here if repair is only to the front section of the front cover.

step1.para: Align timing marks on all gears.
Disconnect wiring at computer. Remove computer and computer mount bracket.
Disconnect wiring at IPR sensor. Disconnect oil and fuel lines from high pressure oil pump. Remove high pressure oil pump.
Remove both idler gears.
Remove camshaft timing disc from cam gear.
Mark camshaft gear in relation to rear cover. Move cam gear slightly in order to remove bolt behind cam gear hole opening. Remove bolt

note.para: This will allow the cam gear puller to take good hold of cam gear for removal. Remove cam gear.

step1.para: Remove lower radiator hose from cover. Disconnect heater hoses from front cover.
Remove bolts retaining rear section of front cover. Remove rear section.

note.para: Use marker crayon, heat cam gear for installation per manual.

step1.para: Clean all gasket and mating surface area before installation.
Install new gasket to rear cover. Install rear cover. Torque bolts to spec.
With camshaft gear heated to 350°, install cam gear. After cam gear cools off, reposition to original location as marked before removal.
Install camshaft timing disc. Torque screws to spec.
Install both idler gears. Torque bolts to spec. per manual. Note timing marks.
Install high pressure oil pump with new gasket. Torque bolts to spec. Connect oil lines, fuel lines and IPR wiring.
Check all timing marks to be sure they are in proper alignment.
Install new gasket to front cover front section. Install front cover. Torque bolts to spec.
Install front engine mount. Torque bolts to spec. Remove bottle jack.
Install bolts retaining air compressor to front cover. Torque bolts to spec.
Tighten/torque bolts at air compressor rear support bracket.

note.para: Torque bolts after front cover bolts have been torqued.

step1.para: Install oil pick up tube and gasket. Install oil pan and gasket. Torque all bolts to spec.
Install alternator support bracket with alternator attached. Torque bolts to spec. Connect alternator wiring.
Install camshaft position sensor with new O-ring.
Install heater hoses and lower radiator hose to rear section of front cover.
Install new coolant filter.
Install oil pump assembly with new gaskets; include crank drift key. Torque bolts to spec.
Install water pump with new gasket. Install pulley. Torque all bolts to spec.
Install crankshaft damper. Torque bolts to spec.

note.para: Heat damper with heating tool per manual before installation.

step1.para: Install fan drive housing and pulley. Torque bolts to spec.
Install computer support bracket and computer include wiring. Torque all bolts to spec.
Install fan drive belt tensioner. Torque bolt to spec.
Install all belts.
Install radiator in position. Leave lifting device attached.
Install fan/clutch assembly.
Install radiator upper/side support struts and lower radiator support bolt. Remove lifting device.
Connect all coolant hoses to radiator assembly.
Install power steering reservoir to radiator frame.
Install A/C lines to A/C dryer and A/C compressor (if applicable).
Install charge air pipes.
Fill cooling system.
Fill engine oil to proper level.
Install hood assembly (2 people).
Lower vehicle.
Install front bumper.
Connect battery.
Charge A/C system (if applicable).
Start engine. Check operation and check for leaks.
Remove wheel chocks.
